definition: thick and heavy in colors/to describe sth in colorful language with attention to detail (idiom)
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead

sentences.english: The article describes Chang'an's prosperity in the Tang dynasty in a rich and colorful manner.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章浓墨重彩地描写了唐长安城的繁华。

sentences.english: In the past several years, OLY people made many colourful cantos .
sentences.chinese: 过去的几年中，奥菱人留下了许多浓墨重彩的篇章。

definition: surging forward with great momentum/unfolding on a magnificent scale
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
miniature version of sth/microcosm/epitome/(Tw) to microfilm
to compose (a piece of music)/(fig.) to create, by one's actions, a narrative (generally one that can be recounted with pride)
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
